title: Ticket #1260: Privsep should look for permission and uid errors at condor startup.
description:
When using privsep there are a number of items that can be validated at startup or reconfig time. This leads to a machine looking like condor is running happily until a job schedules. It would be better to fail earlier so that a problem can be identified. This is what a user probably expects.

For example, if SLOT12_EXECUTE is /home/slot5/execute, but /home/slot5/execute is not in valid-dirs in the privsep config, we know there will be an error at job run time. Condor should error out at this point and show that there is a configuration error. What happens, however, is that we don't get an error until a job runs. And condor will happily continue to match jobs and then reject them at run time.
